Target: The Flood Risk Monitoring ontology (OntoFlood) is an ontology developed for representing flood events as well as flood warnings, together with the risk and (potential) impacts imposed by those events.

Comment: A relationship between a Flood and associated quantities describing its intensity (e.g. water depth, flow velocity).
Label: has intensity

Comment: Flow velocity of the water forming a flood.
Label: Water velocity

Comment: Relative height above ground of the water forming a flood.
Label: Flood depth

Comment: The geospatial distribution of a physical quantity over an area.
Label: Areal distribution

Comment: A relationship between a quantity and its geospatial field distribution.
Label: has geospatial distribution

Comment: Natural components of the environment (e.g. biodiversity, natural habitats, animal species, etc.).
Label: Environmental component

Comment: People who inhabit a territory or state.
Label: Population

Comment: Manmade basic structures or features needed for the functioning of a system or organization.
Label: Infrastructure component

Comment: A relationship between a Flood and affected entities.
Label: affects

Comment: The total number of affected entities (e.g. people, particular infrastructure components)
Label: has count

Comment: A relationship between an affected Infrastructure Component and the corresponding total area affected.
Label: has affected area

Comment: A relationship between an affected Infrastructure Component and the corresponding financial damage estimate.
Label: has total monetary value

Comment: Manmade structures with walls and roof which stand more or less permanently in one place.
Label: Building

Comment: Conveyances used to transport people or objects.
Label: Vehicle

Comment: Network systems, i.e. installations and facilities spreading across land.
Label: Network infrastructure

Comment: Areal installations and land-uses.
Label: Areal infrastructure

Comment: Network-shaped infrastructure to enable transport of people and goods (e.g. roads, railroads).
Label: Mobility network

Comment: Network-shaped infrastructure for provisioning goods (e.g. electricity, gas, water).
Label: Provisioning network

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of residential buildings.
Label: ResidentialArea

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of commercial buildings.
Label: CommercialArea

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of industrial buildings.
Label: IndustrialArea

Comment: Consequences of an event taking place.
Label: Impact

Comment: A relationship between an Event and its effects.
Label: results in

Comment: A relationship between an Impact and the quantification of its cumulative effects in monetary terms.
Label: has monetary value

Comment: Textual description (and classification) of an impact beyond quantification.
Label: has classification

Comment: A relationship between an event and the time interval associated with the duration of the event.
Label: has time interval

Comment: The location associated with an event.
Label: Location

Comment: Polygon describing the footprint of an event.
Label: Areal extent polygon

Comment: An area defined for administrative purposes, e.g. a county or postal code district.
Label: Administrative district

Comment: A relationship between a location and an encompassing administrative district.
Label: has administrative district

Comment: Geospatial extent of an event's footprint.
Label: has areal extent

Comment: Centerpoint of an event's footprint in WGS84 coordinates.
Label: has WGS84 latitude longitude

Comment: A relationship between a (forecasted) event and its geospatial location.
Label: has location

Comment: Area for which a flood warning or alert service is provided (i.e. area to which a flood warning/alert applies).
Label: Flood area

Comment: A forecast of flood risk providing the indication of potential flooding a few days into the future.
Label: Flood forecast

Comment: A measure of hazard potential defined by expected likelihood and forecasted impact.
Label: Risk level

Comment: The probability of a forecasted flood event.
Label: Likelihood

Comment: A relationship between a risk level and the underlying likelihood.
Label: has likelihood

Comment: Textual description of the likelihood of a flood event (e.g. very low, low, medium, high).
Label: has textual description

Comment: Numerical categorisation of the likelihood of a flood event (e.g. on a linear scale from 1 to 4).
Label: has likelihood score

Comment: The likelihood of a flood with very low probability for a flood to materialise (e.g. < 20%)
Label: Very likelihood

Comment: The likelihood of a flood with low probability for a flood to materialise (e.g. 20-40%)
Label: Low likelihood

Comment: The likelihood of a flood with medium probability for a flood to materialise (e.g. 40-60%)
Label: Medium likelihood

Comment: The likelihood of a flood with high probability for a flood to materialise (e.g. > 60%)
Label: High likelihood

Comment: The potential impacts of a forecasted flood event.
Label: Potential impact

Comment: A relationship between a risk level and the underlying impact potential.
Label: has potential impact

Comment: Textual description of the impact potential of a flood event (e.g. minimal, minor, significant, severe).
Label: has textual description

Comment: Numerical categorisation of the impact potential of a flood event (e.g. on a linear scale from 1 to 4).
Label: has impact level

Comment: Minimal impacts expected from a forecasted flood event.
Label: Minimal impact

Comment: Minor impacts expected from a forecasted flood event.
Label: Minor impact

Comment: Significant impacts expected from a forecasted flood event.
Label: Significant impact

Comment: Severe impacts expected from a forecasted flood event.
Label: Severe impact

Comment: A relationship between a flood forecast and its anticipated risk.
Label: has risk level

Comment: A relationship between a flood forecast and the date it applies to.
Label: has date

Comment: The source of water causing the forecasted flooding.
Label: Flood source

Comment: A relationship between a flood forecast and its water source.
Label: has flood source

Comment: Forecasted flooding due to coastal waters (e.g. high tide).
Label: Coastal water

Comment: Forecasted flooding due to ground water.
Label: Ground water

Comment: Forecasted flooding due to river water.
Label: River water

Comment: Forecasted flooding due to surface water/rain.
Label: Surface water

Comment: A relationship between a flood forecast and the actual flood event it refers to.
Label: predicts

Comment: A relationship between a Flood Area and its textual description.
Label: has textual description

Comment: A relationship between a water body and its textual description.
Label: has textual description

Comment: A unique identifier of the Flood Area (e.g. Flood Warnings Direct (FWD) identifier in the UK)
Label: has areal identifier

Comment: A collection of all previously issued flood warnings and alerts.
Label: Flood alert history

Comment: A relationship between a Flood Area and its collection of previous flood warnings and alerts.
Label: has historical warning

Comment: A relationship between the collection of previous flood warnings and alerts and their actual time series history.
Label: has time series

Comment: The potential impact of the flood associated with a flood warning/alert.
Label: Severity

Comment: Flood alert/warning indicating that flooding is possible (i.e. one should be prepared).
Label: Flood alert

Comment: Flood alert/warning indicating that flooding is expected (i.e. immediate action required).
Label: Flood warning

Comment: Flood alert/warning indicating that severe flooding is expected (i.e. danger to life).
Label: Severe flood warning

Comment: Flood alert/warning indicating that the warning is no longer in force.
Label: Inactive flood warning

Comment: A relationship between a Flood Alert/Warning and its severity.
Label: has severity

Comment: Numerical categorisation of the severity level of a flood warning/alert (e.g. on a linear scale from 1 to 4).
Label: has severity level

Comment: Textual description of the severity of a flood warning/alert (e.g. minimal, minor, significant, severe).
Label: label

Comment: A relationship between a Flood Alert/Warning and the actual flood event it refers to.
Label: warns about
